intro: Mecardonia flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellate mecardonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Mecardonia flagellaris is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate foliage and unique growth habit.
